When they come to the end of their rope, when all else fails, such as therapy, counseling, etc., they either commit suicide or decide to give God a try. With nothing to live for and nothing to lose they contact a friend or a friend of a friend and begin to listen to the promises of God as given us through the Bible - true scripture, not the misaligned, misconstrued chatter of mankind. Soon they begin to see a positive change, not only in their life, but also in the events that affect them. They have put God to the test and He has kept His promises. It haunts them, silently, and they begin to think that if they could only forget about it, about that feeling of a gaping hole, that emptiness, that their life would continue to be good and fruitful. Their children see it, their spouse sees it, and friends and neighbors notice it until one day they're approached by one of them with a solution. It is when they test His Word and take that first step that they know that void is filled. That's also when they understand the scripture referring to "The Lord is my Shepherd, I have all I need..."
